Description: The Flight into Egypt; the Virgin and the Christ Child on donkey, led by Joseph; small plate; early state before retouchings; first state before numbering; copy in reverse after Rembrandt Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Claude Henri Watelet (previously attributed)
Curator's comments: This plate was previously attributed to Claude Henri Watelet, but is now believed to have been re-worked and signed by Watelet only in the fourth state. Before then the copper-plate had been in the posession of Jean de Bary and Pieter de Haan. Afterwards it was acquired by Pierre Francois Basan who removed Watelet's signature and included the print in the Recueil Rembrandt, see 1941,0327.11.1. For a later states of this plate see F,4.102 and 1941,0327.11.51. For the original etching by Rembrandt and comment see F,4.100.
Bibliographic references: New Hollstein (Dutch & Flemish) / The New Hollstein: Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts 1450-1700 (117) (Rembrandt; copy e.I)
Hind 1923 / A Catalogue of Rembrandt's Etchings; chronologically arranged and completely illustrated (105) (copy undescribed)
White & Boon 1969 / Rembrandt's Etchings: An Illustrated Critical Catalogue (52) (copy 6)
Acquisition notes: For the history of the acquisition of the Sheepshanks collection, please see Sheepshanks.1
